posts.post_content:
Interestingly, that second ability is one of the set's best answers to [Blightsteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightsteel Colossus), if you also have some infect you can block with.  
  
The first ability is basically an [Ancient Stirrings](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancient Stirrings) that can't fetch land (unless you're playing with colored artifacts from older sets) but still seems like a pretty decent combo enabler.
posts.html:
Interestingly, that second ability is one of the set's best answers to Blightsteel Colossus, if you also have some infect you can block with.

The first ability is basically an Ancient Stirrings that can't fetch land (unless you're playing with colored artifacts from older sets) but still seems like a pretty decent combo enabler.

Posted By: Goatllama (1/31/2011 2:49:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Turn your [Memnites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnites) and [Ornithopters](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ornithopters) into sizeable creatures. Turn your opponent's artifacts into creatures for your removal spells. Obliterate them with Tezzeret's ultimate using Proliferate or simply the first ability (while also protecting him for one turn, of course).   
His first ability is somewhat of a double-edged sword - you can dive fairly deep into your deck and pinch an artifact card of your choice, but you may end up having to place powerful creatures or spells on the bottom your library, which may be too big of a drawback.  
  
Regardless - he's very balanced, yet flavorful and useful, but unlike certain other Planeswalkers, he's really meant to be played just to be removed shortly after (like [Sarkhan the Mad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan the Mad) or possibly [Elspeth Tirel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elspeth Tirel)). Might not see too much play in certain formats, but for many black/blue artifact decks, he'll be a staple.
posts.html:
Turn your Memnites and Ornithopters into sizeable creatures. Turn your opponent's artifacts into creatures for your removal spells. Obliterate them with Tezzeret's ultimate using Proliferate or simply the first ability (while also protecting him for one turn, of course).
His first ability is somewhat of a double-edged sword - you can dive fairly deep into your deck and pinch an artifact card of your choice, but you may end up having to place powerful creatures or spells on the bottom your library, which may be too big of a drawback.

Regardless - he's very balanced, yet flavorful and useful, but unlike certain other Planeswalkers, he's really meant to be played just to be removed shortly after (like Sarkhan the Mad or possibly Elspeth Tirel). Might not see too much play in certain formats, but for many black/blue artifact decks, he'll be a staple.

posts.post_content: Hold on a second. Tezzeret here can make your artifacts into 5/5 creatures. [Sarkhan the Mad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan the Mad) can turn creatures of yours into 5/5 dragons with flying. Tezzeret is UB, Sarkhan is RB, and [Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker) is UBR. I think there's a very weird deck idea here. Slow and ineffective, yes, but it'd be Nicol Bolas and his major underlings. Tezzeret and Sarkhan make your stuff into nice 5/5 bodies, then Nicol Bolas eventually comes out and wrecks shop. This will never work, but I have to try it.
